article.name: Working with Test Mode Campaigns
article.title: Working with Test Mode Campaigns
article.body:
Test mode campaigns allow you to test how your real-time coaching campaigns will perform before you begin to coach your users. You can turn your test mode campaign into a real-time coaching campaign at any time.

Use Cases for Test Mode

For examples of common use cases for Test Mode, see the table below:

New to SecurityCoach Use Test Mode during your first real-time coaching campaign to see how often your users will receive SecurityTips.
Integrating a New Vendor Use Test Mode while integrating a new security vendor to test the vendor’s detection rules and choose which rules you want to coach users on.
Testing Campaign Configuration Use Test Mode when you’re creating a new real-time coaching campaign to test the campaign configuration before you begin sending live SecurityTips to your users.

Create a Test Mode Campaign

To create a test mode campaign, follow the steps below.

  1. Navigate to SecurityCoach > Real-Time Coaching.
  2. Click the + Create Real-Time Coaching Campaign button at the top-right corner of the page.
  3. In the Campaign Name field, enter a name for your test mode campaign.
  4. Enable the Test Mode toggle.
  5. Fill out the fields on the Create New Real-Time Coaching Campaign page. For more information about these fields, see the below screenshot and list:
    1. Campaign Criteria: Select one or more detection rules for this campaign in the Detection Rule drop-down menu.
    2. Additional Criteria (optional): Use this drop-down menu to create additional criteria for this campaign.
    3. SecurityTip Delivery Limit: Select how you would like to send real-time SecurityTips to users. SecurityTips won't be sent while Test Mode is on. Select a delivery limit to get a realistic view of your campaign's performance once Test Mode is off. You can choose either option listed in this section: Limit to one SecurityTip every 20 minutes or Limit to one SecurityTip per day.
  6. Click Create Campaign to save your settings and create your test mode campaign. Or, click Cancel to cancel and return to the Real-Time Coaching subtab.

You can disable Test Mode at any time and activate real-time coaching at any time. After 30 days, the campaign will become inactive and you’ll receive an email summarizing your test mode campaign. To change the email recipient, click Change Recipient at the bottom of the Create New Real-Time Coaching Campaign page.

Individual Test Mode Campaigns

From the Real-Time Coaching subtab, you can click the name of a test mode campaign to view the Overview and Campaign Activity subtabs for your individual campaign. For more information, see the subsections below.

Individual Test Mode Campaign Overview

To learn more about the Overview subtab, see the screenshot below:

  1. Complete Setup: Click this button to finish setting up your test mode campaign to begin real-time coaching. For more information, see the Activate a Test Mode Campaign section.
  2. Campaign Status: This section shows how many days are left for your test mode campaign and the date that testing will end.
  3. Entire History: By default, your test mode overview will display data from the last 90 days. However, you can change this date by clicking on the Entire History drop-down menu and selecting a different date range.
  4. Test Mode Campaign Activity information: This section displays the number of coaching opportunities available, users who would have been coached, and users who would have been coached multiple times during the selected date range. Clicking any icon will redirect you to the Campaign Activity subtab, where the information displayed will correspond to the icon you selected.
  5. Detection Rule Event Summary: This table displays the selected campaign’s detection rules and the number of detections.
  6. Top Coached Users: This table displays a list of your users that received the most SecurityTips during the selected date range. This table will include up to 10 users.
  7. SecurityTips Delivered Over Time: This graph displays the number of SecurityTips that would have been delivered for the selected date range.

Individual Test Mode Campaign Activity

To learn more about the Campaign Activity subtab, see the screenshot below:

  1. Report Type: Use this filter to select the report type.
  2. Detection Rules: Use this filter to select the campaign’s detection rules that you would like to display in this report.
  3. Date Range: Use this filter to select the date range of this data. By default, this is set to show activity from the last 90 days.
  4. User Groups: Use this filter to select the user groups to include in this report.
  5. Delivery Status: Use this filter to select a delivery status to include in this report. You can choose Delivered or Held. SecurityTips aren’t delivered in test mode.
  6. User: Use this search bar to search for a specific user.

Activate a Test Mode Campaign

Once you’re ready to activate your test mode campaign, follow the steps below.

  1. Navigate to SecurityCoach > Real-Time Coaching.
  2. Click the Test filter.
  3. Find the test mode campaign you want to activate.
  4. Under the Actions column, click the three dots icon > Activate Real-Time Coaching.
  5. In the pop-up window that opens, click Complete Setup to finish activating your campaign. You’ll be taken to the Edit Real-Time Coaching Campaign page.
  6. Select a SecurityTip Graphic.
  7. Select a SecurityTip Delivery Method.
  8. After you’ve made your selections, click Activate Campaign to begin coaching your users.

Once your campaign is activated, it will appear in the Active subtab. For more information on managing real-time coaching campaigns, see the Managing and Editing Real-Time Coaching Campaigns section of our Real-Time Coaching Campaigns Guide.

images.alt:
This image displays a configuration screen titled, **"Create New Real-Time Coaching Campaign."**

The configuration panel contains two primary input sections:

1.  **Campaign Name:** A text input field labeled "Campaign Name," currently empty and awaiting user input.
2.  **Test Mode Toggle:** A setting controlling campaign activation.
    *   **UI Elements:** The control features a blue toggle switch, currently set to the **ON** position. It is preceded by a warning icon (triangle or cone) and the label **"Test Mode"** followed by a yellow pill-shaped badge displaying **"ON."**
    *   **Context/Instructions:** Supporting text clarifies the function: "Test how the campaign will perform without sending SecurityTips to your users. You can disable test mode at any time to begin real-time coaching."

*Note: An intrusive orange arrow is visually overlaid on the image, pointing specifically to the active Test Mode toggle.*

mode campaign.
Enable the Test Mode toggle.

images.alt:
This technical manual entry describes a UI for configuring a "New Real-Time Coaching Campaign."

### Campaign Configuration Form Details

**Title and Navigation:**
*   Page Title: **Create New Real-Time Coaching Campaign**
*   Navigation Link: **← Back to Real-Time Coaching**

**1. Campaign Identification and Status**
*   **Campaign Name:** Empty text input field for required naming.
*   **Test Mode:** Toggle switch labeled "Test Mode" is set to **ON**.
    *   Description: "Test how the campaign will perform without sending SecurityTips to your users. You can disable test mode at any time to begin real-time coaching."

**2. Campaign Criteria** (Collapsible Section)
*   **Detection Rules (a):** Defines criteria for coaching delivery.
    *   Instruction: "Select at least one or more detection rules to coach in this campaign."
    *   Input: Dropdown selection field displaying placeholder text "Select one or more..."
*   **Additional Criteria (Optional) (b):** Used to scope users.
    *   Instruction: "Select additional criteria to specify which users you want in this campaign."
    *   Input: Button/Dropdown labeled "Select Criteria."

**3. SecurityTip Delivery Limit (c)** (Collapsible Section)
*   **Warning Banner:** An orange informational alert confirming that "SecurityTips won't be sent while Test Mode is on."
*   **Delivery Options (Radio Buttons):**
    *   **Selected:** **Limit to one SecurityTip every 20 minutes.** (Subtext explains the frequency limit.)
    *   **Unselected:** Limit to one SecurityTip per day. (Subtext explains the 24-hour frequency limit.)

**4. Activation and Recipient Information**
*   **Activation/Expiration Context:** Provides instructions on disabling Test Mode and warns that the campaign will become inactive if not activated before **6/6/2024**.
*   **Email Recipient:** Summary email recipient is specified as `qa@professorphisher.com`, with a "Change Recipient" hyperlink available.
*   **Action Buttons:**
    *   Primary Action: **Create Campaign** (blue button).
    *   Secondary Action: **Cancel** (white button).

images.alt:
This image displays the **Dashboard** view for a **Real-Time Coaching** campaign named **"Data Security - Sharing"** within a security management platform.

### Header and Navigation
*   The page title is **"Real-Time Coaching"**.
*   Primary navigation tabs include **Dashboard, Real-Time Coaching, Detection Rules, SecurityTips, Setup, and Reports**.
*   A link **"← Back to Campaigns"** is present at the top right, next to an **"Edit Campaign"** button.

### Campaign Status and Details
*   **Campaign Details:**
    *   Created: 1/31/2024, 3:33 pm
    *   Vendors: **Microsoft 365, Microsoft MCAS**
*   **Test Mode Banner:** A prominent banner indicates **Test Mode is ON**.
    *   The message states: "SecurityTips aren't sent in Test Mode. Complete your campaign setup to start coaching users in real time."
    *   An action button labeled **(a) "Complete Setup"** is displayed.
*   **Campaign Status (b):**
    *   Indicates **Test Mode** is active.
    *   **"8 days remaining"**.
    *   Text: "Testing will end on 3/20/2024. This campaign will become inactive if it's not activated."
*   Below Campaign Details, there are two tabs: **Overview** (currently selected) and **Campaign Activity**.

### Campaign Performance Metrics
*   The primary metrics section (d) shows three key performance indicators (KPIs) in Test Mode:
    *   **3** Coaching Opportunities | 1 Held (Link: View Details)
    *   **3** Users Coached (Link: View Details)
    *   **0** Users Coached Multiple Times
*   A time filter dropdown **(c)** is set to **"Entire History"**.

### Detection Rule Event Summary (e)
*   This section summarizes rule triggers since the campaign began, listing the **Detection Rule** and **Triggers** count:
    *   External File Sharing Detected by Microsoft Office 365: **4**
    *   Suspicious Email Forwarding Activity: **0**
    *   Suspicious Inbox Forwarding Detected: **0**

### Top Coached Users (f)
*   Lists users who have been coached, indicating the number of times in **Test Mode**:
    *   robertf@kb4demo.com: **1**
    *   laurenall@kb4demo.com: **1**
    *   peggyo@kb4demo.com: **1**

### Security Tips Delivered Over Time (g)
*   A line graph charting activity from 1-31-2024 to 2-20-2024.
*   The Y-axis represents quantity (0 to 4).
*   The X-axis represents dates.
*   The graph displays a dashed line representing **Coaching Opportunities (Test Mode)**, showing a spike of 2 events around 2-10-2024 and another spike of 1 event around 2-18-2024, with zero activity on most other days.
images.context: out the Overview subtab, see the screenshot below:

images.alt:
This image is a screenshot of the **Real-Time Coaching** management interface, displaying the details and activity log for a specific campaign titled **"Campaign: Data Security - Sharing."**

**Header and Navigation:**
The primary navigation bar includes tabs for Dashboard, Real-Time Coaching (active), Detection Rules, SecurityTips, Setup, and Reports. A "Back to Campaigns" link and an "Edit Campaign" action are present in the top right.

**Campaign Status and Test Mode:**
An orange alert banner indicates that the campaign is in **Test Mode (ON)**, stating that SecurityTips are not currently being sent, and includes a prominent "Complete Setup" button.
The **Campaign Status** panel on the right confirms "8 days remaining," ending Test Mode on 3/20/2024, after which the campaign will become inactive if not activated.
The **Campaign Details** panel shows the campaign was created on "1/31/2024, 3:33 pm" and integrates with vendors "Microsoft 365" and "Microsoft MCAS."

**Activity View and Filtering:**
The main content area is split into sub-tabs: "Overview" and "Campaign Activity" (implicitly active, showing the detailed filters). Six filter fields are available for activity analysis:
1.  **Report Type:** Set to "All Campaign Activity."
2.  **Detection Rules:** Set to "All Detection Rules."
3.  **Date Range:** Set to "Entire History."
4.  **User Groups:** Set to "All Users."
5.  **Delivery Status:** Set to "All Users" (Value displayed).
6.  **User:** A search input field is provided.

**Test Campaign Activity Log:**
A data table titled "Test Campaign Activity" lists events with the following sortable columns: Email, Detection Rule, Vendor, Delivery Status, and Detection Date & Time.
The visible sample entry shows a **Detection Rule** of "External File Sharing Detected by Microsoft Office 365," managed by the **Vendor** "Microsoft Office 365." The **Delivery Status** is marked by an orange badge labeled "Delivered," and the event occurred on "2/17/2024, 11:57am."
images.context: ampaign Activity subtab, see the screenshot below:

images.alt:
This image displays a management interface for **"Real-Time Coaching Campaigns"** within a security awareness platform (KnowBe4, Inc.).

**Context and Navigation:**
*   The title is **"Real-Time Coaching Campaigns."**
*   Four filter tabs are visible: **Active, Test (selected/dark gray), Inactive, and All.**

**Table Structure (Headers):**
The table presents campaign data organized under five columns:
1.  **Campaign Name**
2.  **Detection Rules**
3.  **Vendor**
4.  **Status**
5.  **Actions**

**Data Row (Single Entry):**
*   **Campaign Name:** KMSAT Test Mode (blue hyperlink).
*   **Detection Rules:** Clicked Phishing Link Detected by KMSAT.
*   **Vendor:** KMSAT.
*   **Status:** A prominent orange/yellow pill labeled **"Test Mode"** (with a small beaker/flask icon).

**Action Menu (Focus Area):**
Under the "Actions" column, three icons are displayed: a view/eye icon, an edit/pencil icon, and a vertical ellipsis (more options) icon. The ellipsis icon is active, displaying a dropdown menu. An orange arrow highlights this menu.

**Dropdown Menu Options:**
1.  **Activate Real-Time Coaching** (with a whistle icon).
2.  **Deactivate** (with a toggle/switch icon).
3.  **Delete** (with a trash can icon).

**Footer Elements:**
The interface footer includes navigation links (**About, Privacy Policy, Need Help?**) and copyright information (**© 2024 KnowBe4, Inc. All rights reserved**).

This image displays a configuration screen for a "SecurityTip" campaign, focusing on selecting the content and delivery settings.

**1. SecurityTip Text Selection:**
*   A section titled "SecurityTip Text" allows users to select the notification message.
*   Three radio button options are visible, with the first option selected:
    *   **Selected:** "High-Risk Activity Detected, Please Contact Admin (Branded)"
    *   "High-Risk Activity Detected, Please Contact Admin"
    *   "Risky Activity Detected"
*   Each option includes an information icon ($\text{\textcircled i}$) on the right.
*   A "Search" box and a "Show More" button are present.

**2. SecurityTip Preview:**
*   A panel titled "SecurityTip Preview" displays a sample notification.
*   A language dropdown is set to "English (United States)."
*   The preview text begins "Dear Aaron," followed by the sample security message.
*   A placeholder for the graphic ("Select a SecurityTip Graphic") is shown below the text.
*   A "Send me a Test" button is located in the top right of this section.

**3. SecurityTip Graphic Selection:**
*   A section titled "SecurityTip Graphic" allows users to choose an image.
*   Tabs for filtering graphics are labeled "All" (selected), "System," and "Custom."
*   A "Search" box is provided.
*   Four graphic thumbnails are displayed, featuring titles and interaction icons (eye icon, GIF/PDF icons):
    *   "Who Has Access to Your Cloud?" (Selected)
    *   "Did You Mean to Share That Document?"
    *   "Malware Can Infect Your Mobile Device"
    *   "That Might Not Be Who You Think It Is"
*   A "Show More" button is available at the bottom.

**4. SecurityTip Delivery Method:**
*   This section configures how the tips are delivered.
*   Primary messaging app options (radio buttons) are listed, with **Email** selected:
    *   "Slack"
    *   "Microsoft Teams"
    *   **Selected:** "Email"
*   A "Backup Delivery Method" checkbox is enabled for **Email**, with explanatory text: "If a problem occurs with a messaging app, SecurityTips will be sent by email instead."

**5. SecurityTip Delivery Limit:**
*   This section controls the frequency of notifications (radio buttons).
*   The first option is selected:
    *   **Selected:** "Limit to one SecurityTip every 20 minutes" (Description: "Users won’t receive more than one tip every 20 minutes for this campaign.")
    *   "Limit to one SecurityTip per day" (Description: "Users won’t receive more than one tip every 24 hours for this campaign.")

**6. Action Buttons:**
*   Two final action buttons are located at the bottom of the interface: "Activate Campaign" and "Cancel."
